node.title: Watch the 1960s Come Alive in ‘Last Night in Soho’
node.description: Edgar Wright narrates a dreamy sequence from his film featuring Thomasin McKenzie and Anya Taylor-Joy.
node.content: ["In \u201cAnatomy of a Scene,\u201d we ask directors to reveal the secrets that go into making key scenes in their movies. See new episodes in the series on Fridays. You can also watch our collection of more than 150 videos on YouTube and subscribe to our YouTube channel.", "A song from Cilla Black and some flashing lights from a French bistro summon a little dreamy 1960s magic in this scene from \u201cLast Night in Soho,\u201d a thriller by the director Edgar Wright.", "Thomasin McKenzie stars as a fashion student with \u201960s obsessions who is, as Wright puts it, \u201csupernaturally switched on.\u201d", "As she goes to sleep in her new flat, she has a dream that takes her back to her favorite decade, across a busy street in London and into a lavish nightclub. In this video, Wright explains the more-complicated-than-it-looks nature of timing flashing lights to the beats of a song, as well as other practical effects he used to create a mirror-image moment (actually building a \u201cmirror\u201d set and using twin actors on either side of it),", "Read the \u201cLast Night in Soho\u201d review.", "Sign up for the Movies Update newsletter and get a roundup of reviews, news, Critics\u2019 Picks and more."]
